definitions.definition: An acute , highly infectious often fatal disease caused by Variola virus of the family Poxviridae . It was completely eradicated in the 1970s, but still exists in laboratories. Those who survived were left with pockmarks .
examples: The Europeans brought new diseases such as smallpox , measles, dysentery, influenza, syphilis and leprosy.

main_definition: ( pathology ) An acute , highly infectious often fatal disease caused by Variola virus of the family Poxviridae . It was completely eradicated in the 1970s, but still exists in laboratories. Those who survived were left with pockmarks .
